about.name: New Orleans
about.info_text: New Orleans, often referred to as the 'Big Easy,' is a unique and lively city located in Louisiana. Known for its rich cultural heritage, jazz music, delicious cuisine, and vibrant festivals, New Orleans offers a one-of-a-kind experience. From the historic French Quarter with its charming architecture to the annual Mardi Gras celebrations, the city is a melting pot of culture and a hub for music and art.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 390,000
State: Louisiana
Time Zone: Central Time Zone (UTC-06:00)
Languages: English, French, Creole
Currency: United States Dollar (USD)
about.climate_text: New Orleans has a humid subtropical climate with hot and humid summers and mild winters. It's an excellent destination for experiencing live music and savoring delicious Creole and Cajun cuisine.

attractions_card.title: French Quarter
attractions_card.description: The French Quarter is the historic heart of New Orleans, known for its iconic architecture, lively streets, and famous sites like Jackson Square and Bourbon Street.

attractions_card.title: Garden District
attractions_card.description: The Garden District features beautiful mansions, oak-lined streets, and is a prime location for exploring New Orleans' charming residential neighborhoods.

attractions_card.title: Mardi Gras
attractions_card.description: Mardi Gras is an annual festival known for its elaborate parades, vibrant costumes, and lively celebrations. It's a must-experience event in New Orleans.

attractions_card.title: Jackson Square
attractions_card.description: Jackson Square is a historic park in the French Quarter, surrounded by notable landmarks such as St. Louis Cathedral and the Cabildo.

attractions_card.title: National WWII Museum
attractions_card.description: The National WWII Museum is a world-class institution dedicated to the history of World War II, featuring interactive exhibits and artifacts.

attractions_card.title: Frenchmen Street
attractions_card.description: Frenchmen Street is renowned for its live music venues, jazz clubs, and a vibrant nightlife scene, making it a favorite spot for music lovers.

attractions_card.title: St. Louis Cemetery
attractions_card.description: St. Louis Cemetery No. 1 is a historic above-ground cemetery, known for its unique graves and crypts.

attractions_card.title: Steamboat Natchez
attractions_card.description: The Steamboat Natchez offers Mississippi River cruises with live jazz music, providing a scenic and musical journey.

food_card.title: Gumbo
food_card.description: Gumbo is a hearty and flavorful Creole stew made with a variety of ingredients, including meat or seafood, served with rice.

food_card.title: Jambalaya
food_card.description: Jambalaya is a spicy and aromatic rice dish with a mix of meats, vegetables, and Creole seasonings, a true New Orleans classic.

food_card.title: Beignets
food_card.description: Beignets are square-shaped donuts covered in powdered sugar, best enjoyed with a caf√© au lait, and are a signature New Orleans treat.

food_card.title: Crawfish Boil
food_card.description: Crawfish boils are festive gatherings featuring seasoned crawfish, corn, and potatoes, a beloved Louisiana tradition.

food_card.title: Po' Boys
food_card.description: Po' Boys are sandwiches filled with a variety of fried or grilled ingredients, often served on French bread with distinctive dressings.

hotels_card.title: The Roosevelt New Orleans
hotels_card.description: The Roosevelt New Orleans is a historic luxury hotel with elegant accommodations, a rooftop bar, and fine dining.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Monteleone
hotels_card.description: Hotel Monteleone is a family-owned hotel in the French Quarter, known for its literary heritage and the famous Carousel Bar.

hotels_card.title: Omni Royal Orleans
hotels_card.description: Omni Royal Orleans offers classic elegance, a heated rooftop pool, and is located in the heart of the French Quarter.

hotels_card.title: Ace Hotel New Orleans
hotels_card.description: Ace Hotel New Orleans is a trendy and artistic boutique hotel in the Warehouse District with a rooftop pool and live music events.

hotels_card.title: The Troubadour Hotel
hotels_card.description: The Troubadour Hotel combines modern style with a vibrant atmosphere, offering comfortable rooms and a rooftop bar.

hotels_card.title: The Old No. 77 Hotel & Chandlery
hotels_card.description: The Old No. 77 Hotel is an artsy boutique hotel with exposed brick walls and a unique, creative ambiance.

hotels_card.title: The Pontchartrain Hotel
hotels_card.description: The Pontchartrain Hotel features a mix of vintage and modern design, offering comfortable accommodations, a rooftop bar, and scenic views of the city.

hotels_card.title: Henry Howard Hotel
hotels_card.description: The Henry Howard Hotel is a historic boutique hotel in the Garden District, known for its elegant decor and charming atmosphere.

transport_card.alt: Louis Armstrong New Orleans International Airport
transport_card.title: Louis Armstrong New Orleans International Airport
transport_card.description: Louis Armstrong New Orleans International Airport (MSY) is the major airport serving the city, offering both domestic and international flights.

transport_card.title: Streetcars
transport_card.description: New Orleans' iconic streetcars provide a historic and scenic way to explore the city, with lines running through various neighborhoods.

transport_card.title: Buses and Trolleys
transport_card.description: Public buses and trolleys operated by the Regional Transit Authority (RTA) offer convenient transportation options within New Orleans.

transport_card.title: Taxis and Ridesharing
transport_card.description: Taxis, Uber, and Lyft services are readily available for getting around the city and to nearby attractions.

transport_card.title: Riverboats
transport_card.description: Riverboats like the Steamboat Natchez offer scenic cruises along the Mississippi River, providing a unique perspective of the city.
